meanings.definition: A small wave or series of waves on the surface of water, especially as caused by a slight breeze or an object dropping into it.
meanings.sent1: The ripples in the pond grew larger as the stone sank.
meanings.sent2: I love watching the ripples form when I skip stones across the lake.
meanings.sent3: The duck seemed puzzled by the ripples it created while swimming.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter created ripples of joy that spread through the room.
meanings.sent5: The ripples danced on the water, reflecting the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: A feeling or effect that spreads through a person or group of people.
meanings.sent1: The ripples of excitement were palpable in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The ripples of fear spread quickly among the students.
meanings.sent3: His joke caused ripples of laughter to ripple through the room.
meanings.sent4: The news sent ripples of shock through the community.
meanings.sent5: Her kindness created ripples of warmth in everyone she met.
